questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Microsoft Teams and 300 Microsoft Teams-certified IP phones.
You need to locate, group, and filter the IP phones based on keywords.
What should you use?

Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription.
You plan to configure the environment to allow external users to collaborate in Microsoft Teams by using guest access.
The company implements a new security policy that has the following requirements:
✑ Only guest users from specific domains must be allowed to connect to collaborate by using Microsoft Teams.
✑ Guest users must be prevented from inviting other guests.
You need to recommend a solution to meet the security policy requirements.
Solution: From PowerShell, you run the New-CSExternalAccessPolicy and
Set-CSExternalAccessPolicy cmdlets.
Does this meet the goal?

discussion.content:
B. No is correct

Set-CsExternalAccessPolicy:

"Enables you to modify the properties of an existing external access policy. External access policies determine whether or not your users can: 1) communicate with users who have Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) accounts with a federated organization; 2) communicate with users who are using custom applications built with Azure Communication Services; 3) access Skype for Business Server over the Internet, without having to log on to your internal network; 4) communicate with users who have SIP accounts with a public instant messaging (IM) provider such as Skype; and, 5) communicate with people who are using Teams with an account that's not managed by an organization."

This cmdlet is not used to manage Guest User permissions. 

These permissions are controlled through AAD -> External Collaboration
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
Guest governance is not managed via Teams External Policy. More over, Guest Domain governance is done via Azure AD (External Identities) so PS commands shouldn’t have “CS”

Selected Answer: B
guest users ?
go with audience poll!. answer is B

Selected Answer: B
No is correct because the cmdlets are for external users not for guests

Selected Answer: A
However the PowerShell commands are applied to Teams too (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/skype/new-csexternalaccesspolicy?view=skype-ps) and can be used to Create and Set external settings. Isn't the most cleaner way, but is a way

Selected Answer: B
I would go for option B as New-CSExternalAccessPolicy command is used for modifying SFB/Online setting. Guest Invitation setting and allowing guest from specific domain (collaboration restriction) is controlled through Azure Active Directory .

Selected Answer: B
I go with B. SfB is only a portion of Teams component and I think the question is pointing to a broader scenario that involves the tenant. Additionally Set-CsExternalAccessPolicy does not apply to SfB online or Teams.

B. Is the correct answer. Allow or block invitations to B2B users from specific organizations power shell settings are here. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/external-identities/allow-deny-list

The answer is No, the Set-CsExternalAccessPolicy can will resolve issue of guest access domain. However, Set-CsExternalExternalAccessPolicy will not resolve guess access permission to invite guest users

Answer is correct. In Microsoft Teams, a resource account is required for each auto attendant or call queue. Resource accounts may also be assigned service telephone numbers. MS Exchange Sever**** does not apply to Teams. MS 365 room resource account is the only correct answer. MAC Address is Needed to identify the device.

Microsoft 365 resource accounts are mailbox and Teams accounts that are dedicated to specific resources, such as a room, projector, and so on. These resource accounts can automatically respond to meeting invites using rules you define when they're created.
Correct

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Microsoft Teams.
You plan to deploy a Microsoft Teams display device.
You need to enable automatic provisioning.
Which type of resource account should you create, and what should you use to identify the device? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Correct
On Test 18.01.22

Selected Answer: B
Windows Performance Analyzer is a powerful tool for analyzing system and network performance on Windows machines. It can be used to inspect network traffic and identify if QoS markings are present on the packets related to Microsoft Teams calls. By capturing and analyzing network traces, WPA can help confirm whether QoS policies are effectively applied to prioritize Microsoft Teams traffic.

Selected Answer: A
Option A is correct Answer, you can download Skype for Business Network Assessment Tool which does connectivity test with Microsoft Teams.
https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=53885

Selected Answer: A
correct answer is A

The answer is correct - Microsoft Teams Network Assessment Tool provides the ability to perform a simple test of network performance and network connectivity to determine how well the network would perform for Microsoft Teams calls.
https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=103017
Usually, you have to install the tool on 2 different PCs, which are located in different locations
is it still relevant in 2021?

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription.
You plan to implement Microsoft Teams.
You need to perform network quality and connectivity tests from an on-premises network to Microsoft 365 Online services by using the Network Testing
Companion.
You install the Network Testing Companion module on a local Windows 10 device.
Which additional software should you install to perform the tests?

Your company has a Microsoft 365 tenant that uses Microsoft Skype for Business Online.
All users connect to Skype for Business Online by using computers that run Windows 10.
You plan to upgrade all the users from Skype for Business Online to Microsoft Teams.
You need to ensure that the Microsoft Teams client is installed automatically on all the computers.
What should you do from the Teams admin center?

discussion.content: answer is correct : B : https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/setting-your-coexistence-and-upgrade-settings

Selected Answer: B
However, this option is no longer located under org wide settings as that has been deprecated. Instead it is now located in the Teams AC under Teams > Teams upgrade settings

comments.content: Agreed and confirmed in live tenant.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Teams >> Teams upgrade Settings >> App preferences >> Download the Teams app in the background for Skype for Business users.
Will go for B: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/setting-your-coexistence-and-upgrade-settings

Selected Answer: B
Answer B is correct since ONLY Windows computers are in question for Teams client automatic installation. The same is mentioned in - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/setting-your-coexistence-and-upgrade-settings
If the requirement is Teams setup on Andrioid/iOS then Intune is the best option.

discussion.content: C is the correct answer. Org-Wide Settings -> Teams upgrade -> App preferences -> Download the Teams app in the background for Skype for Business users.

choices.D: From the Teams policies settings, modify the Global (Org-wide default) Teams policy.
choices.C: From Teams apps, add an App setup policy.
choices.A: From the Messaging policies settings, modify the Global (Org-wide default) messaging policy.
choices.B: From Org-wide settings, configure the Teams upgrade settings.
